turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Anastasia (wife of Constantine IV).
turn.1: Who was the wife of Constantine IV?
turn.2: Anastasia (wife of Constantine IV)  Anastasia (c. 650 – after 711) was the Empress consort of Constantine IV of the Roman Empire.
turn.3: When did she enter historical record?
turn.4: Anastasia entered historical record when her husband Constantine IV succeeded to the throne in 668.
turn.6: On September 15, 668, her father-in-law Constans II was assassinated in his bath by his chamberlain.
turn.7: What else is significant about this event?
turn.8: He resided for the last few years of his reign in Syracuse, while Constantine and Theodora remained in Constantinople.
turn.10: Anastasia became the senior Empress consort when news of the assassination reached the court.
turn.12: The birth of her first son, Justinian II, can be estimated to 668/669 due to the chronologies of Theophanes the Confessor and Ecumenical Patriarch Nikephoros I of Constantinople.
